descript.abstract: This GIS data set includes the nearshore bathymetry of the central east coast of Florida, including the Indian River Lagoon, as lines representing bathymetric contours and polygons representing the depth ranges between the contours. While only the polygon data are served on the ArcIMS site, line contours are also available by request. Please see the Distribution Information section below for data request procedures. Geonex digitized the contours during 1991-1992 from clean, wrinkle-free paper National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) nautical charts. Geonex used the most current versions of the charts available at that time. The source charts used to create this data set varied in scale from 1:10000 to 1:80000, but in all cases, the largest scale charts available were used. Geonex staff members also interpolated additional contours not present on the charts.
descript.purpose: This data set was created to represent marine depth contours and depth range polygons, primarily for cartographic purposes.
descript.supplinf: Prior to July 1, 2004, the Fish and Wildlife Research Institute (FWRI) was known as the Florida Marine Research Institute (FMRI). The institute name has not been changed in historical data sets or references to work completed by the Florida Marine Research Institute. The institute name has been changed in references to ongoing research, new research, and contact information. These data are not to be used for navigation. User should be aware that later versions of the source charts may be available and that contours may have changed. Consult the appropriate coast pilot and the most recent paper or digital charts available. (previous geoform was 'vector digital data')

place.placekey: St. Johns River Water Management District

idinfo.accconst: All data must be verified by Principal Investigator or Group Database Analyst prior to release. It is strongly recommended that this data is directly acquired from FWC and not indirectly through other sources which may have changed the data in some way. FWC makes no claims as to the data's suitability for other purposes.
idinfo.useconst: FWC-FWRI and the originator of the data must be credited. This is not a survey data set and should not be utilized as such. These data are not to be used for navigation. Acknowledgement of the FWC-FWRI (Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission-Fish and Wildlife Research Institute) as the data source would be appreciated in any products developed from these data, and such acknowledgment as is standard for citation and legal practices for data source is expected by users of this data. Please cite the original metadata when using portions of the record to create a similar record of slightly altered data, such as reprojection. If any data are modified or adjusted, please share the edited information with FWC. Users should be aware that comparison with other data sets for the same area from other time periods may be inaccurate due to inconsistencies resulting from changes in mapping conventions, data collection, and computer processes over time. FWC shall not be liable for improper or incorrect use of this data. These data are not legal documents and are not to be used as such. This is not a survey data set and should not be utilized as such. These data are not to be used for navigation.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 2000 Version 5.0 (Build 2195) Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcCatalog 8.1.0.642

attracc.attraccr: FWRI has checked all arc features for DEPTH attribute accuracy and D-coding accuracy and continuity. For the polygon features, the D-RANGE attribute was checked for accuracy and consistency. In the areas in which the positional accuracy was not corrected (see Horizontal Positional Accuracy Report), the attribute accuracy was only corrected for logical consistency in DEPTH, D-codes, and D-RANGE.

dataqual.logic: FWRI performed a thorough quality assurance and quality control check of these data during the Fall of 2001, including a check on positional accuracy, depth attribute accuracy, and D-coding accuracy and continuity. To check the data, FWRI used historical 1992 or prior NOAA nautical charts: 11485_03-06, 11484, 11475, 11476, 11478_01, 11474, 11472_01, 11472_02, 11472_04-06, and 11472_09. In all cases, the largest scale charts were used for verification. DEPTH and D-coding attributes are logically consistent.
dataqual.complete: Geonex interpolated 3-ft contours in places where they were absent from the charts. Some contours were not digitized if they were below the minimum mapping unit for the scale of the largest scale chart present for an area. The 24-ft contour was not digitized because it was only present on one 1:24000 scale chart off Port Canaveral. Some nearshore areas were not corrected for positional accuracy because the contours in the data set were so different from the contours present on available nautical charts. It is suspected in such cases that these contours may have been digitized from a different source. These areas include: Port Canaveral, Ponce de Leon Inlet, St. Lucie River, St. Lucie Inlet, and the Indian River North of SR 520 to a channel north of Sharpes. In the areas that the positional accuracy was not corrected, attribute accuracy was only corrected for logical consistency in DEPTH, D-codes, and D-RANGE.

horizpa.horizpar: FWRI staff moved the original linework to the positions shown on the 1992 or prior NOAA nautical charts when the contours were in error by more than 1/10 of a map-inch. Some nearshore areas were not corrected for positional accuracy because the contours in the coverage were so different from the contours present on the available nautical charts that it is suspected these contours may have been digitized from a different source. These areas include: Port Canaveral, Ponce de Leon Inlet, St. Lucie River, St. Lucie Inlet, and the Indian River from north of SR 520 to a channel north of Sharpes. Contours that were not present in the data set, but were present on the nautical charts were digitized, with the exception of very small contour areas and the 24-ft contour that was only present on the 1:24000 scale chart off Port Canaveral.

citeinfo.origin: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, National Ocean Service
citeinfo.title: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration Nautical Charts - various

srcinfo.srccontr: Geonex digitized the nearshore contours from the largest scale charts available.

procstep.procdesc: Geonex digitized the nearshore contours from clean, wrinkle-free paper National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) nautical charts. Geonex used the most current versions of the charts available at that time. The source charts used to create this data set varied in scale from 1:10000 to 1:80000, but in all cases, the largest scale charts available were used. In some areas, Geonex staff members interpolated additional contours not present on the charts.

cntinfo.cntinst: Avineon was formerly called Agra Baymont, which was previously GEONEX.

procstep.procdesc: FWRI checked and corrected the positional and attribute accuracy of the polygon and arc feature classes against 1992 or prior NOAA nautical charts. Except in select nearshore areas, positional accuracy was adjusted if there was a difference greater than 1/10 of a map-inch between the coverage and the nautical chart. See "Logical Consistency Report," "Completeness Report," "Attribute Accuracy," and "Positional Accuracy" sections for further explanation of results.

enttyp.enttypd: This data set represents bathymetry contours in arc format.

attr.attrdef: True or false for the condition shoreline; 0 = false, 1 = true
True or false for the condition DEPTH = 100 feet; 0 = false, 1 = true
True or false for the condition DEPTH = 12 feet; 0 = false, 1 = true
True or false for the condition DEPTH = 120 feet; 0 = false, 1 = true
True or false for the condition DEPTH = 180 feet; 0 = false, 1 = true
True or false for the condition DEPTH = 3 feet; 0 = false, 1 = true
True or false for the condition DEPTH = 30 feet; 0 = false, 1 = true
True or false for the condition exposed at mean lower low water; 0 = false, 1 = true
True or false for the condition DEPTH = 6 feet; 0 = false, 1 = true
True or false for the condition DEPTH = 60 feet; 0 = false, 1 = true
True or false for the condition inland water; 0 = false, 1 = true
True or false for the condition dredged channel; 0 = false, 1 = true
True or false for the condition spoil; 0 = false, 1 = true
True or false for the condition frequently changing; 0 = false, 1 = true
True or false for the condition chart border; 0 = false, 1 = true

This field indicates the depth (in feet) of the shallowest contour represented by the line. In cases where a non-depth item is represented, a special 3-digit number is used to describe the feature. The following values can be found in this data set: 0 = shoreline 3 = 3 feet 6 = 6 feet 12 = 12 feet 18 = 18 feet 30 = 30 feet 60 = 60 feet 100 = 100 feet 120 = 120 feet 555 = exposed at mean lower low water 777 = dredged channel 888 = spoil 889 = frequently changing 999 = chart border

attrdomv.udom: This field indicates the depth (in feet) of the shallowest contour represented by the line. In cases where a non-depth item is represented, a special 3-digit number is used to describe the feature. The following values can be found in this data set: 0 = shoreline 3 = 3 feet 6 = 6 feet 12 = 12 feet 18 = 18 feet 30 = 30 feet 60 = 60 feet 100 = 100 feet 120 = 120 feet 555 = exposed at mean lower low water 777 = dredged channel 888 = spoil 889 = frequently changing 999 = chart border

enttyp.enttypd: This data set represents bathymetry contours in polygon format.

attr.attrdef: This value represents the depth of the area between two contours. The value of the deeper depth contour is assigned to this item. In cases where a non-depth item is represented, a special 3-digit number is used to describe the feature. The following values can be found in this data set: 0 = Land 3 = 0 to 3 feet 6 = 3 to 6 feet 12 = 6 to 12 feet 18 = 12 to 18 feet 30 = 18 to 30 feet 60 = 30 to 60 feet 100 = 60 to 100 feet 120 = 100 to 120 feet 555 = exposed at mean lower low water 666 = inland water 777 = dredged channel 888 = spoil area 889 = frequently changing area 999 = greater than 120 feet

attrdomv.udom: This value represents the depth of the area between two contours. The value of the deeper depth contour is assigned to this item. In cases where a non-depth item is represented, a special 3-digit number is used to describe the feature. The following values can be found in this data set: 0 = Land 3 = 0 to 3 feet 6 = 3 to 6 feet 12 = 6 to 12 feet 18 = 12 to 18 feet 30 = 18 to 30 feet 60 = 30 to 60 feet 100 = 60 to 100 feet 120 = 100 to 120 feet 555 = exposed at mean lower low water 666 = inland water 777 = dredged channel 888 = spoil area 889 = frequently changing area 999 = greater than 120 feet

attr.attrdef: Textual description of D_RANGE attribute value

attrdomv.udom: Textual description of D_RANGE attribute value

overview.eaover: Each line contour contains the attribute DEPTH, which represents the shallowest contour depth in feet. Special non-depth items are indicated by 3-digit codes. The D-coding attributes represent the presence or absence of each contour value. Each polygon contains the attribute D-RANGE, which represents the deepest depth value within the range.
overview.eadetcit: Each line contour contains the attribute DEPTH, which represents the shallowest contour depth in feet. Special non-depth items are indicated by 3-digit codes. The D-coding attributes represent the presence or absence of each contour value. Each polygon contains the attribute D-RANGE, which represents the deepest depth value within the range.

stdorder.fees: None. However, persons or organizations requesting information must provide transfer media if FTP is not available and must pay express shipping costs if express shipping is required.
stdorder.ordering: Contact GIS Librarian by e-mail, telephone, or letter explaining which products are needed and providing a brief description of how the products will be used. Also, provide name and address of the person or organization requesting the products.
stdorder.turnarnd: Usually within 10 business days, although, complex requests may take longer
